safe_to_remove.name: Windows Photo Viewer
safe_to_remove.description: The Photos app for managing images.

safe_to_remove.name: Microsoft Solitaire Collection
safe_to_remove.tip: Safe to remove. You may be bored though.

safe_to_remove.name: Clipchamp Editor
safe_to_remove.tip: Safe to remove, as this is a very limited version.

safe_to_remove.name: Windows 3D Viewer
safe_to_remove.description: Used to view 3D models in real time.

safe_to_remove.name: Microsoft Cortana
safe_to_remove.tip: Doesn't come with Windows 11, but there might be systems that have it installed.

may_cause_breakages.name: Windows Maps
may_cause_breakages.description: A program used to view maps. Similar to how Google Maps is for Android.
may_cause_breakages.tip: Safe to remove; however, Windows Widgets might break with forecast.

may_cause_breakages.name: Windows Bing News
may_cause_breakages.description: A program used for news via Widgets.
may_cause_breakages.tip: Safe to remove; however, the widgets might not show news correctly, if at all.

may_cause_breakages.name: Microsoft Xbox App
may_cause_breakages.tip: Safe to remove; however you might have issues with connecting PC to your XBOX

may_cause_breakages.name: Microsoft Xbox GameBar
may_cause_breakages.tip: Safe to remove; however you might have issues with recording, screenshotting. Games may show an error that the overlay is missing. Easy to fix, though

may_cause_breakages.name: Microsoft Store
may_cause_breakages.tip: Will break driver installations, and possibly cripple the system since most programs are via store. NOT safe to remove.
